name: Maury Place at Monument

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Many classic inns or b & b's tend to be old and tired, where the guest must compromise on modernity in lieu of the old and historic. No such compromise here! The public areas are bright, airly and most inviting. The breakfast is classy and off the charts good!
reviews.title: One of the finest stays we've had anywhere in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was the Pathfinder suite and while the bathroom was a bit small, the room is simply off the charts! Read that as a truly great room, very large, fantastic bed and linens, a wonderful large balcony and top notch TV, fireplace and stereo.
reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is simply as close to perfect as it could be. My only regret about Richmond and Maury Place is that we had to leave too soon.
reviews.title: Southern Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: May 2011, I traveled with my mom as a dual Mother's Day getaway, it has been many years since we'd gotten to spend some time just "us." (I have the oldest of 7 and I have 4 children.)
reviews.title: Maury Place was fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maury Place was AMAZING! We hit bad weather on the way to the Inn and Donna called to check on us. She gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations, even calling to make certain one was still open at 9:45pm. Donna was so accommodating with the breakfast menu and time. Oh, and she is a WONDERFUL cook! The pictures of this Inn do not do it justice.
reviews.title: Richmond's Finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is the first B&B I have picked that I thoroughly enjoyed from the time I made the reservation to when I said goodbye to Jeff and Donna, the innkeepers, when our stay was over. They do everything right. They have mastered the art of providing luxury with ease. You feel sincerely welcome. They do not hover but will meet your every expressed need without fuss. NO detail was overlooked - and I am picky. The room was a perfect mix of contemporary amenities within a flawlessly executed period decor. The bed provided a great night's sleep and I loved the waterfall shower in the morning.
reviews.title: Do yourself a favor - stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I was at a business meeting, my wife visited the Faberge exhibit at a nearby museum with a newly-made friend whom she met a breakfast at Maury House that morning. The two of them then met up with two other guests at the B&B from Australia for lunch. It was sort of the architypal B&B experience.
reviews.title: We had a wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you go to RIchmond - or live there - plan a stay at Maury House. Two days will seem like a week's vacation!
reviews.title: Beautiful place and wonderful service, YOU MUST GO!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Maury Place is beautiful, well-kept and historically interesting. The rooms are luxurious and furnished in period pieces. The innkeeper is very gracious and welcoming. All amenities are included - deluxe toiletries, robes, complementary wine, excellent breakfast. The bed was very comfortable. Walking in to our suite and hearing light classical music playing on the two flat screen TVs instantly made us relax. Behind the house is a charming patio that has an Italian feel to it and includes a small swimming pool and hot tub. We had such a relaxing and enjoyable stay and plan to return. It is also conveniently located, within easy walking distance of Careytown.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B--Beautiful and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved Maury Place. Donna, the assistant innkeeper, was a wonderful hostess who made sure we had a spectacular time. Our room was beautiful and exceptionally clean, the pool was lovely and the inn was walking distance to many sites and restaurants. We will definitely be back again! Perfect place for a weekday/weekend getaway. Very classy---LOVED IT!
reviews.title: Nicest Stay Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are pleased to echo the many wonderful reviews of Maury Place. The house has been beautifully and very tastefully restored and yet it isn’t stuffy – it’s more comfortably luxurious. The innkeepers know how to make you feel welcomed and attended to without being intrusive. The rooms have every amenity you could think of (and some you couldn’t). We particularly enjoyed the wonderfully refreshing swimming pool, but in colder weather we would no doubt also enjoy warming ourselves by the fire in either our guest room or the living room. The breakfast in the mornings was served in a gorgeous dining room and was absolutely delicious. Drinks and snacks are available to guests 24 hours a day at no additional charge. We also enjoyed morning coffee and evening wine on the front porch, which is very pleasant and good for people watching. And the Fan District location has lots of character, good restaurants, and is very central for touring Richmond – especially the nearby Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, which is not to be missed.
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Richmond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maury Place is a special treat. This is your chance to stay in a beautifully restored and furnished historic home with wonderful innkeepers and breakfast. Pictures do not do it justice. Owner/ innkeeper Jeff is appropriately proud of this spectacularly renovated and decorated home from 1916. The furnishings are beautiful, and his collected rugs, antiques and art/ objects incredible. I wished he would come decorate our home. Innkeeper Donna, warm and charming, who served us a terrific breakfast, confessed that she tried to prepare rooms with individual visitors in mind. We found ours immaculate and welcoming, with chocolates and classical music playing softly when we arrived. The shower was a marvel. I really did not want to leave. We sat up late reading in the sitting room so we could enjoy this spectacular home as long as possible. The nearby (walking distance) Viriginia Museum of Fine Arts is well worth a visit. If you are vacationing in Richmond, this is the place!
reviews.title: Historic treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just vacated our home in Richmond and needed a place to stay for return visits to family. We now have a new "home away from home". This meticulously restored house is elegant, comfortable, and comes with exceptional service from the innkeepers, Jeff and Mac. The delicious breakfast is served in a stunning dining room with fine linens and English china....just perfect.
reviews.title: A true gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have traveled the world, stayed in many hotels and B&B's and can honestly say that Maury Place is among the best. Treat yourself to the Pathfinder Suite with a king four poster, comfy seating area, private porch with chaise lounges, and carrera marble bath......you will love it.
reviews.title: The best B&B ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything about Maury Place at Monument is top notch! The renovation is amazing and so tastefully done. It's absolutely gorgeous and yet comfortable at the same time. Everyone associated with the establishment is terrific. Donna took care of my parents' every need with aplomb. We have never stayed in a place where the people were this gracious and the architecture so compelling. It's a wonderful location from which to see Richmond too.
reviews.title: Our home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Richmond to see the Picasso exhibition at the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts and could not have been more pleased with our B&B choice. It is among the very best B&Bs we've stayed in...beautiful ambiance, wonderful hospitality, fabulous breakfasts and charming conversation with the guests and innkeepers. We highly recommend Maury Place and plan to return in the future.
reviews.title: Elegant Home in the Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maury Place is one of the most outstanding B & B's it has ever been our pleasure to experience! I could not recommend a stay there (at least 2 days), more highly. The inn itself is magnificent and has been done with the greatest of love and care. The service is superlative as are the actual room acommodations/amenities and, the price is just right! Oh, did I mention that the owner's and innkeepers are just the best? Well they are! Just go!
reviews.title: Maury Place: A Must on Everyones' Bucket List!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful old home in outstanding condition, spotlessly clean, beautifully decorated, and run by an extremely friendly and efficient staff. Our room was very nice, and the breakfast was delicious. Great location. We've stayed in many B&B's, and this is our favorite so far.
reviews.title: The best B&B we've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on the night of our wedding and fell in love with every aspect of this beautiful B&B. From the gracious hosts, to the exquisite decor, luxurious rooms, perfect location, scrumptious breakfast- we just cannot say enough good things about Maury Place. We stayed in the Pathfinder Suite, which has a private balcony overlooking Monument Ave- the perfect place to unwind after our wedding! We felt like royalty and are looking forward to going back... you can bundle up by the fireplace in your room in the winter or enjoy their pool in the summer. It is within walking distance to Zeus Gallery- one of the best restaurants in Richmond- and the VMFA/VHS. Simply incredible find in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Perfect ending to a perfect day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jeff and Mac, our hosts at Maury Place, added special touches that made our stay even more appealing than having a quiet location within walking distance to the VMFA and the picturesque Monument Avenue and Boulevard neighborhood near Carytown. The chocolates by the bed were wonderful! Everything was sparkling clean, and our room, the "Fontaine Suite," featured ironed sheets, lots of pillows, and reading lamps on both sides of the queen bed -- a real plus. Breakfast was at a long dining table in the formal dining room. The former residence of a physician, the rooms downstairs seem made for entertaining guests. The breakfast menu included fresh berries, a "baked oatmeal" dish and scones. We will stay there again when we go to Richmond.
reviews.title: Terrific location near VMFA, Carytown & Monument Blvd, great rooms and host.

description: Relax in the refined elegance of this historically preserved 1916 home. Four unique guest suites feature modern amenities including private (en suite) bathrooms and secure wireless internet. Our neighborhood location overlooking Monument Avenue is centrally located to shopping, dining, local universities, and the downtown business district. We are walking distance to the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, Virginia Historical Society, and the Virginia Center for Architecture. Two very sweet inn dogs on property.
